# Introduction
## Study organisation

### Question 1
```{r}
course <- vroom(
  here("data", "courses.csv"),
  col_types = cols(
    course    = col_character(),
    course_id = col_integer(),
    semester  = col_integer(),
    nb_grades = col_integer()
  )
)
```

### Question 2
```{r}
courses_table <- course |>
  arrange(course) |>
  rename(
    `course name`      = course,
    identifier         = course_id,
    semester           = semester,
    `number of exams`  = nb_grades
  )

courses_table |>
  kable()
```

## Students
```{r}
students <- vroom(
  here("data", "students.csv"),
  col_types = cols(
    id         = col_integer(),
    group      = col_factor(),
    birth_date = col_date(format = ""),
    sex        = col_factor()
  )
)
class(students$birth_date)
class(students$sex)
```
The `birth_date` column of the students data frame is of class Date, and `sex` is a factor.

## Grades
### Question 4
```{r}
grades <- vroom(
  here("data", "grades.csv"),
  delim = "|",
  na = "_",
  col_types = cols(
    id        = col_integer(),
    course_id = col_integer(),
    grade     = col_double()
  )
)
```


# Students population analysis
### Question 5

```{r}
ggplot(students, aes(x = group)) +
  geom_bar() +
  labs(x = "Group", y = "Number of students")
```
